final_answer:
The image humorously contrasts typical in-flight safety instructions with an exaggerated scenario. On the left, we see standard emergency procedures being demonstrated, such as using oxygen masks and looking out the window calmly, which is labeled "YES."

On the right, labeled "BUT," the scene becomes surreal and satirical. An exaggerated situation shows an airplane releasing tiny people, who are depicted comically falling out, while a larger figure with a briefcase is fleeing dramatically. This visual juxtaposition mocks the seriousness and calm demeanor of safety instructions by contrasting it with utter chaos and absurdity. It plays on the unlikely event of an actual emergency and the belief that passengers would remain calm, highlighting the disparity between instruction and reality in a humorous way.
ground_truth: These images are funny since it shows how we are taught emergency procedures to follow in case of an accident while in an airplane but how none of them work if the plane is still in air
